node.title: UK supermarket removes 'use by' dates on its milk, tells customers to use 'sniff test' instead
node.description: It's estimated just over 278 million litres of milk is wasted each year in the UK
node.content: ["Prominent UK supermarket Morrisons will remove the 'use by' dates on the majority of its milk and ask customers to use a sniff test to check for quality.\u00a0", "Morrisons will now place \"best before\" dates on 90 percent of its own-brand milk while encouraging consumers to use a sniff test to check quality.\u00a0", "\"Generations before us have always used the sniff test - and I believe we can too,\" Ian Goode, senior milk buyer at Morrisons said.", "The supermarket chain believes the move could save millions of litres of its own-branded milk being poured down the drain each year.\u00a0", "It's estimated just over 278 million litres of milk is wasted each year in the UK according to recycling charity Wrap, the third most wasted food and drink product behind potatoes and bread.", "Wrap also estimates that over 40 million litres are wasted due to customers following \"use by\" dates, despite research showing it can be used days after the date.\u00a0", "\"Wasted milk means wasted effort by our farmers and unnecessary carbon being released into the atmosphere,\" Goode said.\u00a0", "\"Good quality, well-kept milk has a good few days life after normal 'use by' dates - and we think it should be consumed, not tipped down the sink.", "\"So we're taking a bold step today and asking customers to decide whether their milk is still good to drink. Generations before us have always used the sniff test - and I believe we can too.\"", "Wrap is \"delighted\" that Morrisons has made the \"bold move\" to become the first UK supermarket to remove 'use by' dates in an effort to help reduce food waste.\u00a0", "\"I am delighted that Morrisons is the first UK supermarket to take this important step to help reduce household food waste - it shows real leadership and we look forward to more retailers reviewing date labels on their products and taking action,\" Marcus Gover of Wrap said.", "Morrisons has already scrapped 'use by' dates on some of its own-branded yoghurt and hard cheese ranges."]
